title: LeBron saves day as putback at buzzer lifts L.A.
content: LeBron James tipped in a missed floater by Luka Doncic with 0.2 seconds remaining for his eighth career game-winning buzzer-beater, lifting the Lakers past the Pacers 120-119.

title: New Giants QB Wilson: 'I expect to be the starter'
content: Russell Wilson said he expects to be the starting quarterback of a Giants team that also signed Jameis Winston as a free agent and could be in the market for a quarterback in this year's draft.

title: LeBron opens up on relationship with idol Jordan
content: LeBron James opened up about the current relationship between him and Michael Jordan as part of a wide-ranging interview that aired Wednesday on "The Pat McAfee Show."

title: Hurley: Regret remarks, but not changing as coach
content: UConn coach Dan Hurley acknowledged there are things that "I wish I didn't do" as he expressed regret over making profane comments about the officiating after the Huskies' NCAA tournament loss to Florida on Sunday.

title: Mavs' Irving has successful surgery on torn ACL
content: Mavericks All-Star Kyrie Irving underwent successful surgery to repair his torn left ACL on Wednesday at Hospital for Special Surgery in New York City, the team announced.

title: Police: UGA's Tuggle driving 107 mph upon arrest
content: Georgia wide receiver Nitro Tuggle was driving 107 mph before he was stopped and arrested by police on March 19, according to an Athens-Clarke County Police Department incident report.

title: NFL expects more returns if kickoff pitch passes
content: The NFL competition committee is recommending making the dynamic kickoff rule permanent and moving touchbacks to the 35-yard line in hopes of generating even more returns.

title: Books set historically low win total for White Sox
content: The White Sox open the season with a consensus over/under of 53.5 wins, the lowest betting total for sportsbooks in over 35 years.

title: 'I feel like I have everything in front of me': Inside the $765 million marriage of Juan Soto and the Mets
content: After a free agent megadeal that rocked the offseason, a new era begins for the Mets, New York and all of MLB.

title: The mercurial backcourt motoring Notre Dame's March Madness
content: Hannah Hidalgo, Olivia Miles and Sonia Citron had their ups and downs. But now Notre Dame is in the Sweet 16, and the dynamic guard trio is driving toward a title.

title: Predictions: The case for and against every team to reach the regional final
content: Why every Sweet 16 team could win (or lose) its regional semifinal matchup in Birmingham and Spokane.

title: NHL playoff watch: Are the Minnesota Wild in trouble?
content: A once-solid hold on playoff position now seems tenuous. Plus, projections for the entire postseason bracket.

title: How effects of Michigan hacking are rippling nationwide
content: The allegations have left much of college athletics concerned about what other athletes might be victims.

title: SGA or Jokic for MVP? Answering the biggest NBA awards questions
content: Our insiders break down the biggest NBA awards questions, including the MVP battle between Nikola Jokic and Shai Gilgeous-Alexander.

title: Three-pointer problem? Why the NBA has no qualms with it -- yet
content: This season has witnessed a historic number of 3-pointers. But does the league really need to rein it in?

title: Who's leading the Golden Boot races in Europe's top leagues?
content: Here are the players on top of the Premier League, LaLiga, Bundesliga, Serie A and Ligue 1 scoring charts.

title: Scaloni: Stop pressuring Messi over '26 World Cup
content: Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni said Lionel Messi will decide whenever he wants if he plays at the 2026 World Cup.

title: Davies' agent slams Canada staff over ACL tear
content: Alphonso Davies' agent hit out at the player's treatment by Canada staff after it was announced that he has suffered a torn ACL against the United States, saying that the Bayern Munich star was "pressured" to play despite not being fully fit.

title: Sources: Brazil set to decide Dorival's future
content: The Brazilian Football Confederation (CBF) will discuss the future of Brazil coach Dorival Junior at a meeting on Friday, sources told ESPN Brasil.

title: Boston's NWSL team reveals new name -- again
content: In a move to recover from a disastrous branding rollout five months ago, the expansion NWSL team has announced Boston Legacy Football Club as its new franchise name, superseding BOS Nation FC.

title: Slegers hails Arsenal comeback against Madrid
content: Arsenal manager Renee Slegers praised her side's stirring comeback in their 3-0 win over Real Madrid in the Women's Champions League on Wednesday.

title: Source: Onana wants Utd stay, plans to rebuff SPL
content: André Onana intends to stay at Manchester United even if he receives an offer from Saudi Arabia, a source has told ESPN.

title: Chelsea fans call for Boehly ticket site probe
content: Chelsea fans have asked the Premier League to investigate co-owner Todd Boehly's links to a ticket resale site.

title: Vini: Brazil must 'rethink everything' after loss
content: Vinícius Júnior has called for Brazil to push the reset button following their alarming 4-1 defeat at Argentina in Tuesday's World Cup qualifier.

title: Paige Bueckers' pursuit: The national championship that keeps getting away
content: Will Paige Bueckers win an elusive NCAA title or become the greatest UConn player to graduate without one?

title: You can't stop Cooper Flagg: 'He wants to win every possession'
content: Arizona's best chance of defending Duke's star is by limiting him. Here's how -- and why it might not be enough.

title: Top seed Boston College plays with Gaudreaus, Voce close to hearts
content: Three former Eagles died this past summer. The current team hopes to win a national title in their memory.

title: NBA betting: Why you should fade the Celtics in these two markets
content: The Celtics lead two key futures markets entering Wednesday night's game but here's why bettors should be cautious.

title: EA Sports F1 25 release date, details, cover revealed
content: EA Sports' latest racing game is set to be released on May 30, 2025, for PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S.

title: MLB The Show 25 Review: Small but worthwhile upgrades
content: MLB The Show 25 doesn't revolutionize the genre, but it's the best game in the series with some fun ideas.

title: Mikaela Mayer-Sandy Ryan rivalry explained: All you need to know
content: Ahead of their rematch on Saturday, we look at the Mayer vs. Ryan feud, the paint incident, and more.

title: World Cup Onside/Offside: Will Argentina repeat? Will Spain win? USA has work to do
content: With the international break done and dusted with all the major World Cup contenders in action, who's looking sharp right now and who needs work in the next 14 months? LME breaks it down.

title: The divergent fortunes of U.S.'s Pochettino, Mexico's Aguirre
content: While Mauricio Pochettino's team has yet to lift off, Javier Aguirre's Mexico squad has already lifted silverware.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye Ekitike as Isak alternative
content: Arsenal have identified Eintracht Frankfurt striker Hugo Ekitike as an alternative to Newcastle's Alexander Isak. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: At least 6 feared dead after tourist submarine carrying 45 sinks off Egypt's coast
content: At least six people are feared dead and nine injured after a tourist submarine sank off Hurghada's coast in Egypt's Red Sea. Named Sindbad, the submarine had over 45 Russian tourists on board when it sank during a coral reef exploration. Rescue efforts saved 29 people. Investigations are ongoing as authorities look into the cause of the incident.

title: Shreyas Iyer to regain BCCI central contract; discussion on March 29
content: Shreyas Iyer is expected to regain his BCCI central contract for the 2024-25 season after an impressive performance. Ishan Kishan's contract status is still under discussion. Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Ravindra Jadeja will likely remain in the highest category. Axar Patel may be promoted. Varun Chakravarthy, Nitish Kumar Reddy, and Abhishek Sharma are set to receive their first contracts.

title: Gold smuggling case: Actor Ranya Rao's bail plea rejected for 3rd time
content: Kannada actress Ranya Rao's bail plea was dismissed by the Bangalore Sessions Court after her arrest for smuggling Rs 12.56 crore worth of gold. Authorities seized 14.2 kg of gold from her at the airport. Sahil Jain, a Ballari gold dealer, was also arrested for allegedly assisting her.

title: How to create Ghibli-style portraits without paying for ChatGPT Plus
content: OpenAI's new GPT-4o update has sparked a trend of Studio Ghibli-style portraits, exclusive to select ChatGPT subscription tiers. Despite the delay in the free-tier rollout, users can create similar artworks using free alternatives like Gemini, GrokAI, Craiyon, Artbreeder, and various premium platforms offering free trials.

title: Amit Shah hails 'new Bharat' as two more Hurriyat groups quit
content: Union home minister Amit Shah announced that two more Hurriyat Conference affiliates in Jammu and Kashmir have renounced separatism. The groups have embraced the vision of a new India under Prime Minister Narendra Modi, signaling the decline of separatism in the region. Earlier, two Hurriyat affiliates had similarly abandoned separatism.

title: Watch: KL Rahul’s Pietersen mimicry leaves everyone in splits
content: KL Rahul has joined his new franchise, Delhi Capitals, after missing the season opener against Lucknow Super Giants due to the birth of his first child. In a viral video, he humorously mimicked DC mentor Kevin Pietersen, delighting the team. Acquired for Rs 12 crore, Rahul is set to make his debut for DC.

title: Kunal Kamra’s ‘message' to T-Series after getting legal notice on Naya Bharat
content: Kunal Kamra criticizes T-Series for flagging his stand-up special, Naya Bharat, over the use of a song from 'Dil To Pagal Hai.' Kamra argues that parody and satire fall under fair use. He also jabs at Ola founder Bhavish Aggarwal, questioning his priorities. T-Series states Kamra lacked authorization for the song's use.

title: ‘Will not apologise’: SP MP on Rana Sanga remark, cites Nehru's book
content: SP MP Ramji Lal Suman refuses to apologise for his remarks on Rana Sanga, citing historical sources including Nehru's book. Following the remarks, an alleged Karni Sena mob vandalized Suman's residence. Opposition parties staged a walkout, accusing the BJP of failing to prevent the violence.

title: Why Haryana changed Eid-ul-Fitr to restricted holiday
content: The Haryana government has announced that Eid-ul-Fitr on March 31 will be a restricted holiday instead of a gazetted holiday due to the financial year-end. Income Tax Department offices will remain open from March 29 to 31 to assist taxpayers. RBI has also directed banks handling government transactions to stay open on March 31 for special clearing operations.

title: Watch: Fan thrashed for trying to come close to SRK at Eden Gardens
content: A fan attempting to meet Kolkata Knight Riders co-owner Shah Rukh Khan at the IPL 2025 opener against Royal Challengers Bengaluru was stopped and thrashed by police at Eden Gardens. During the match , another fan did breach security to get close to Virat Kohli. On Wednesday, a fan got close to Riyan Parag of Rajasthan Royals in Guwahati.

title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos on what changed about Donald Trump this term
content: Jeff Bezos noted significant changes in President Trump during his second term, highlighting his calmer and more confident demeanor. He appreciates the administration's efforts towards reducing regulations and fostering dialogue with business leaders, signifying an improved relationship between the two influential figures.

title: Sambhal violence: Court denies interim bail to mosque chief Zafar Ali
content: A district court rejected the interim bail plea of Shahi Jama Masjid president Zafar Ali, scheduling his regular bail petition for April 2. He was arrested for his alleged involvement in the November 24 violence triggered by a survey of the mosque, leading to five deaths and significant unrest.

title: Who is WWE's El Grande Americano? Exploring the identity of the man behind the mask
content: El Grande Americano, a new masked luchador on the WWE roster, has been making an impression on Monday Night RAW. Many fans speculate that he is Chad Gable, considering the moves and physique similarities. The storyline is developing, with intriguing twists around El Grande Americano's identity.

title: Ex-cricketer baffled by Rajasthan's decision to play in Guwahati
content: Rajasthan Royals' decision to use Guwahati's Barsapara Cricket Stadium as their second home for IPL 2025 is proving disadvantageous, as they suffer consecutive losses. Former cricketer Aakash Chopra criticizes the unconventional scheduling and notes the pitch does not favor Rajasthan Royals' strengths. He also pointed out that the pitch at Guwahati’s ACA Stadium was not ideal for Rajasthan Royals.

title: Bangladesh plan to redefine ‘muktijoddha’ stirs debate in Bengal
content: Deliberations are underway in Kolkata to redefine the term 'bir muktijoddha' to only include battlefield fighters and classify others as 'Liberation War Associates'. This proposal has sparked debates and raised concerns about the recognition and possible ignoring of genuine freedom fighters and the distorting of historical contributions.

title: Ranya Rao gold smuggling case: DRI arrests third suspect
content: Kannada actress Ranya Rao was arrested for smuggling 14.2 kg of gold worth Rs 12.56 crore from Dubai. The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence arrested gold dealer Sahil Jain and hotelier Tarun Konduru Raju for aiding her. Despite Ranya Rao's admitted use of hawala channels for financing, her bail plea remains under consideration, highlighting a significant breakthrough in the smuggling case.

title: Doull suggests moving the KKR franchise from Eden Gardens
content: Kolkata Knight Riders secured their first win of the IPL season by defeating Rajasthan Royals, thanks to Quinton de Kock's unbeaten 97. The Eden Gardens pitch controversy emerged, with KKR's request for a spin-supportive pitch denied by the curator, prompting calls to consider moving the franchise to a different venue.

title: After viral assault video, boxer Sweety Boora says husband is gay
content: Former world champion, Sweety Boora, has accused her husband, Deepak Hooda, of domestic abuse and hidden preferences amidst a viral altercation video. She alleges video manipulation and police biased support, despite previously lodging an FIR for dowry harassment against Hooda. Both faced-off, leading to conflicting claims and legal action.

title: Cong workers clash with Odisha Police over suspension of MLAs, 2 cops hurt
content: A massive clash erupted in Bhubaneswar as Congress demanded an investigation into crimes against women during BJP's tenure. Protests turned violent, injuring police personnel and leading to calls for a peaceful march to the Odisha Assembly. Criticism arose over police actions, while 12 Congress MLAs faced suspension for indiscipline amid political tensions.

title: How to watch March 29 partial solar eclipse in US
content: A partial solar eclipse will happen on March 29, 2025. It will be visible in the northeastern US and parts of Canada at sunrise. Key locations for viewing include New York, Massachusetts, Maine, and more. Viewers should use protective measures like eclipse glasses. The event offers a unique viewing experience with a crescent-like effect.

title: Why VP Dhankar rejected Cong's privilege notice against Shah
content: Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar has dismissed a breach of privilege notice filed by Congress's Jairam Ramesh against Union Home Minister Amit Shah. Dhankhar determined there was no breach of privilege, validating Shah's comments with historical documentation and stressing the need for responsible parliamentary conduct.

title: Elon Musk is world’s richest person on Hurun Rich List with $420bn net worth
content: Elon Musk has claimed his title as the world's richest person again, with his net worth reaching $420 billion due to an 82% increase primarily from Tesla's stock surge. However, his wealth decreased by $100 billion post-January 2025 due to competition and investor concerns.

title: Known for soiling himself to evade arrest, Delhi's 'Potty Badmash' nabbed
content: Delhi police arrested the notorious pickpocket and knifer, Deepak, known as 'Potty Badmash', who evaded capture by soiling himself. Equipped with gloves and masks, officers thwarted his attempt near Eidgah Park, uncovering his 'lucky charm' knife and linking him to multiple thefts and knife-related crimes.

title: Harbhajan responds to criticism of Hindi commentary quality
content: Harbhajan Singh addressed a fan's critique regarding current Hindi commentary in cricket, noting the reduction in analytical content. The fan's video highlighted how past commentators enriched viewers’ understanding of the game. Harbhajan assured improvements would be made, contrasting this response with his previous defence of Hindi commentary against naysayers, stirring a debate.

title: MP Rashid seeks relief from 'Rs 1.45L/day' Tihar-Parliament travel cost
content: Baramulla MP Engineer Rashid approaches Delhi High Court to modify the order allowing him to attend parliamentary sessions in custody. He seeks waiver of the Rs. 1.45 lakh daily travel expense from Tihar Jail. His plea highlights the unaffordability of the cost and the absence of such conditions in previous instances. The hearing is scheduled for tomorrow.

title: India caught in crossfire as Trump's auto tariffs roil supply chains
content: US President Donald Trump has imposed a 25% tariff on imported cars and auto parts, aimed at boosting domestic automotive manufacturing. This move could disrupt global supply chains, impacting India’s auto parts industry. Major Indian suppliers may need to explore new markets to counter the potential decline in US demand. Talks for a US-India bilateral trade agreement are ongoing.

title: Gujarat Olympic dreams: Asaram ashram to turn sporting arena
content: Preparations for the 2036 Olympics in Ahmedabad include acquiring land from three ashrams, such as Sant Shree Asaram Ashram, to develop the Sardar Patel Sports Enclave and Olympic Village. The master plan involves approximately 650 acres near the Narendra Modi Stadium, with land finalizations and relocations underway.

title: Saturn (Shani) transit in Pisces coincides with New Moon on March 29: Details
content: March 29, 2025 marks a transformative day as the New Moon aligns with Saturn's transit in Pisces, signaling a period for emotional healing, spiritual growth, and introspection. This unique astrological event encourages resetting intentions, re-evaluating relationships, and setting long-term goals through disciplined spiritual practices. A potent time for achieving emotional stability and manifesting dreams with perseverance.

title: 'Will badly affect Muslims': TN assembly passes resolution against Waqf bill
content: Tamil Nadu chief minister MK Stalin has urged the central government to withdraw the proposed Waqf amendment bill, stating it would negatively impact minority Muslims. The bill, which has not yet been introduced in the Lok Sabha, has sparked opposition due to concerns it would hinder the Waqf Board’s powers.

title: Vyshak Vijaykumar reveals discussion with Iyer, Arshdeep
content: Punjab Kings' Vyshak Vijaykumar's disciplined bowling in the death overs, guided by Arshdeep Singh's strategic input, played a pivotal role in their 11-run victory over Gujarat Titans in the IPL. Skipper Shreyas Iyer's selfless leadership and Vyshak's execution under pressure demonstrated a cohesive team effort. This win showcases Punjab Kings' potential under Iyer’s captaincy.

title: Ambani drops out of world’s top 10 richest persons list - check details
content: Mukesh Ambani, Chairman of Reliance Industries, faced a significant drop in wealth, exiting the global top 10 richest list due to rising debt levels. However, he remains Asia's richest person. Elon Musk became the world's wealthiest with $420 billion net worth.

title: Bengaluru judge cites non-existent SC rulings to pass verdicts
content: The Karnataka high court has recommended action against a city civil judge in Bengaluru for referencing non-existent Supreme Court judgments in a ruling. The case involves plaintiffs who sought injunctions against lenders. The high court has asked for an investigation and appropriate action.

title: 'MS Dhoni doesn't react to ... ': Gukesh on how Dhoni shaped his chess career
content: Reigning world chess champion D Gukesh Dommaraju has named legendary cricketer MS Dhoni as his idol, admiring Dhoni's composure under pressure. Gukesh credits Dhoni's calmness and clear thinking in high-stakes situations for positively influencing his approach to handling pressure in his chess games. Recently, Gukesh spoke about his deep admiration for Dhoni and the significant role the cricketing icon has played in shaping his mindset and approach to pressure situations.

title: Woman scientist injured in attack by pitbull and doberman in Mumbai
content: A 37-year-old scientist in Mumbai's Powai suffered serious injuries and needed nose reconstruction surgery after being attacked by a Pitbull and a Doberman. The dogs belonged to Divesh Virk and were under his driver and maid's care when the attack happened. Police have filed a case against all three and are investigating the incident.

title: Tiny Intruder: Child crawls through White House fence, quickly rescued
content: A young child breached the White House perimeter by crawling through the fencing near the North Lawn. Secret Service personnel quickly intervened and reunited the child with their parents without incident. This isn't the first such occurrence; a similar breach happened earlier in April 2023.

title: Encounter breaks out in J&K's Kathua, search operation launched
content: Security forces have cordoned off an area in J&K's Kathua district after terrorists were spotted. Reports indicate an exchange of fire occurred as forces initiated a search operation in the Ghati Juthana area. This search is part of an ongoing anti-terror effort that began four days ago.

title: 'Putin will die soon,' says Zelenskyy amid Russia president's ill health rumors
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy claimed Vladimir Putin is soon to die, as speculation about the Russian leader's health intensifies. Zelenskyy and French President Emmanuel Macron presented a unified stance, urging EU solidarity and increased military aid amidst ongoing conflicts and unreliable ceasefire agreements.

title: 'Will chop you, seal you in drum': UP woman threatens alcoholic husband
content: A woman from Meerut threatened her alcoholic husband with dismemberment if he didn't change his behavior. The husband, who had visible injuries from being hit with a brick, reached the police but decided to reconcile without filing a formal complaint. The couple has been struggling with frequent disputes due to the husband's drinking habit.

title: French journalist forced to leave India in 2024 given one-year work permit
content: In January 2024, she was served a notice by the Foreigners Regional Registration Office, alleging that her reports created a ‘biased negative perception about India’

title: Indian fisherman, arrested for illegal fishing, dies in Pakistan jail
content: According to information from the Edhi Foundation, Ansar Burney Welfare Trust and government sources, around 190 Indian fishermen are still languishing in Pakistani jails

title: ‘L2: Empuraan’ movie review: Mohanlal, rich production design fail to save this sequel
content: ‘Empuraan’, unlike its predecessor, has hardly anything going for it, except for the richness of its production design

title: AAP leader says denied anxiety meds in jail, court seeks medical report
content: Special Judge Kaveri Baweja directed the officials of Mandoli Jail to file the report by March 28 after Balyan claimed that he was being denied the anxiety medicine recommended by a doctor

title: Minor boy converted to Islam in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar; three detained
content: The FIR was registered under relevant sections of BNS and UP Prohibition of Unlawful Conversion of Religion Act, 2021, police said

title: Team formed to clear heaps of discarded furniture at MGMGH
content: Heaps of old furniture lying at several places on the premises of the hospital has become an eyesore and they have also become a haven for rodents

title: Swineherd community worried over strong action against pig menace in Karaikal
content: The damage to farmlands caused by pigs — especially during harvest season — has been a recurring issue in the region; paddy farmers have repeatedly represented to the authorities in this regard

title: Karnataka to hold fresh survey of Scheduled Castes within 60 days to collect empirical data for internal reservation
content: The survey is to overcome the confusion in nomenclature of Adi Karnataka, Adi Dravida, Adi Andhra and other scheduled castes (who have not declared sub caste), which were coined prior to independence.

title: Telangana 2023-24 CAG report: 45% of 1.69 lakh crore spent on salaries, pensions and interest payment
content: The receipts including revenue receipts and capital receipts however were ₹2.19 lakh crore, over ₹40,000 crore lower than the budget estimates of ₹2.59 lakh crore

title: Parliamentary panel flags ‘non-contribution’ by private sector employers in employees’ fund
content: Parliamentary Committee highlights non-payment of provident fund by private sector employers, urges government to address grievances with EPFO.

title: Indian fishermen detained by Sri Lanka: Our government has inherited the problem, says Jaishankar
content: Mr. Jaishankar further noted that the majority of the fishermen detained in Sri Lanka are from Tamil Nadu and Pondicherry due to geographical proximity

title: Parliamentary panel for lateral entry in CBI; new law to probe national security cases without state consent
content: The panel said a separate, new law granting the CBI wider investigative powers without the consent of states for cases affecting national security and integrity may be enacted

title: ‘A good start’: Indian and Sri Lankan fishermen hold talks after nine years
content: Speaking to The Hindu from Sri Lanka over the phone, fishermen leader V.P. Jesu Raja said a five-member delegation from Rameswaram had arrived in Sri Lanka after they made a representation to T.N. Chief Minister M.K. Stalin to arrange for a personal meeting with the jailed fishermen there

title: Rabha council polls: Assam tribe to participate after 10 years
content: The Garo National Council said it would continue to seek a separate autonomous council for the community

title: Justice Varma issue: Opposition MPs demand statement by Law Minister in Lok Sabha
content: While it was too premature to apportion guilt or otherwise, Parliament was nevertheless charged with the responsibility of exercising superintendence over the judiciary, Congress leader Manish Tewari said

title: Rana Sanga ‘traitor’ remark row: Ramji Lal Suman says he will not apologise
content: Agra police lodged an FIR against an “unknown mob” on March 27, a day after Mr. Suman’s residence was attacked, allegedly by members of the Karni Sena

title: Justice Yashwant Varma case: How High Court judges are repatriated and why the NJAC was struck down?
content: The alleged discovery of cash at a High Court judge’s residence has reignited scrutiny over the judicial transfer process and the system that afforded the government a foothold in judicial appointments

title: Friday namaz on roads, rooftops gatherings prohibited for safety: Sambhal police
content: ‘No restrictions on offering namaz in the traditional way inside mosques and Eidgahs, and they will be conducted peacefully according to tradition,’ Sambhal ASP Shreesh Chandra said

title: Will help people within the country: Nirmala Sitharaman’s banter as Raghav Chadha raises conditions of banks
content: I was amused, sir, If Member Raghav Chadha does not take offense, he observed the number of fans in the bank, the condition of the bank, how many were whitewashed and not painted. I am really so, so satisfied, says the Union Finance Minister

title: Centre issues heatwave advisory to States/Union Territories
content: Directs all hospitals to ensure preparedness for management of heatstroke cases and heat-related illnesses

title: Tribal man killed in suspected animal attack near Ooty
content: The remains of the man, identified as Kenthar Kuttan, a member of the Toda Adivasi community, was discovered in a forested area by local residents on Thursday

title: NWKRTC earns ₹104.68 crore from UPI transactions, decides to run additional buses for festival
content: North Western Karnataka Road Transport Corporation (NWKRTC), which has extended UPI transaction facility to passengers in buses operated by 50 depots has now registered over 1 crore UPI transactions.

title: Sambhal violence: Court refuses interim bail to Shahi Jama Masjid president
content: Shahi Jama Masjid president Zafar Ali denied interim bail after being arrested for inciting violence.

title: Madhya Pradesh HC allows incineration of remaining Union Carbide waste at Pithampur facility
content: Of the 350 tonne waste that was transported from the defunct Union Carbide factory in Bhopal to the Pithampur industrial area in Dhar district, 328 tonne toxic waste now remains to be disposed of

title: Telangana Assembly passes resolution urging Centre take up delimitation after extensive consultations
content: Telangana CM calls on all parties to join the fight against Centre’s delimitation move on population basis

title: Vladimir Putin accepts PM Modi's invitation to visit India, preparations underway: Russian FM Lavrov
content: “Arrangements are currently being made for Putin to visit India,” says Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov

title: BJP’s organisational structure leaves little room for RSS intervention, says RSS Kerala office-bearers
content: RSS Kerala office-bearers say the interests of the organisation and BJP however remain closely aligned

title: Implement NRC and identify illegal migrants: Manipur MP in Rajya Sabha
content: With the current law and order situation in Manipur, it would not be conducive to alter the existing electoral constituencies of the State, BJP MP Sanajaoba Leishemba said during Zero Hour

title: Maharashtra govt summons Kunal Kamra for insulting `traitor', remains silent on Solapurkar: Uddhav Thackeray
content: Rahul Solapurkar recently came under fire after stating in a podcast that Shivaji Maharaj escaped from Agra Fort by bribing Mughal Emperor Aurangzeb’s officials

title: It was during YSRCP regime that Hindu Dharma was protected: Jagan Mohan Reddy
content: Jagan Mohan Reddy alleged that the Hindu Dharma and temples came under attack after NDA formed the government in June 2024

title: Justice Varma transfer: CJI Khanna assures Bar leaders to consider demand for withdrawal of Collegium recommendation
content: The representatives of six Bar associations of different High Courts met the CJI and other collegium members — Justices B R Gavai, Surya Kant, Abhay S Oka and Vikram Nath — in the afternoon.

title: Kishan Reddy wants Kancha Gachibowli lands to be declared as national park
content: Mr. Kishan Reddy was particularly concerned about the endangered species of star tortoises in the region

title: With no takers for tenders, Bangalore University’s Food Court has not served students for over a decade
content: Students and some local vendors say that bidders are hesitant to come forward owing to BU’s idea of providing the space for rent.

title: Willing to restrict online real money games for 19 hours a day, gaming company tells Madras High Court
content: It, however, opposes Tamil Nadu Online Gaming Authority’s insistence that the blank hours must be imposed only between 12 midnight and 5 a.m.

title: Regional Meteorological Centre in Chennai draws ire for issuing weather bulletins in Hindi too
content: The move has sparked controversy among leaders from Tamil Nadu, who have alleged that it is another attempt to impose Hindi on non-Hindi-speaking States

title: IIT professor booked for researcher's death near archaeological site in Gujarat
content: Surabhi Verma (23), a PhD scholar at the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi, died after a 10-feet deep excavation pit collapsed on her

title: Amendments will cripple Waqf Boards and their autonomy, says T.N. CM Stalin
content: Accusing the BJP government at the Centre of functioning with “ulterior motives” on all issues, Mr. Stalin alleged all its schemes were aimed at “betraying the interests” of a particular section of society

title: Corporate-driven media trying to create anti-Left narrative, says Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Pinarayi says covering up facts and circulating misinterpreted content will ‘gradually emerge as a threat to the secular nature of the country’

title: Pay ₹40 lakh compensation for illegal occupation of Lodhi-era monument: SC to RWA
content: A bench of Justices Sudhanshu Dhulia and Ahsanuddin Amanullah refused to waive off the cost and posted the matter for hearing on April 8

title: IPL 2025: Water bottles, selfie sticks among 12 items prohibited at Hyderabad stadium
content: Bringing prohibited items is at your own risk as there is no cloakroom available for storage: Rachakonda police

title: Nearly 25,000 km of highways to be widened to four lanes for ₹10 lakh crore: Nitin Gadkari
content: Nitin Gadkari also said 16,000 km of National Highways will also be converted into six lanes for ₹6 lakh crore

title: Four special needs children die, over dozen fall sick at Lucknow rehab; probe on
content: Tragic incident at a government rehabilitation centre in Lucknow leaves four special needs children dead and 16 ill

title: Ruckus in Jharkhand Assembly over BJP leader Anil Mahto's murder; House adjourned
content: Within two minutes of the start of the proceedings, Speaker Rabindra Nath Mahato adjourned the House till 12.55 p.m. as legislators of both the Opposition and the treasury bench trooped into the Well

title: Justice H.N. Nagmohan Das Commission submits interim report to CM on internal reservation among Scheduled Castes in Karnataka
content: The report would pose a challenge for the Congress government in Karnataka as several groups are vying for higher share in the quota

title: T.N. CM Stalin moves demands for grants in Assembly on behalf of indisposed Deputy CM
content: Mr. Stalin told the Assembly that Udhayanidhi Stalin “is not well, and doctors have advised him to take rest”

title: Dhankhar rejects privilege notice against Amit Shah
content: Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh moved the notice against Amit Shah Shah for "casting aspersions" on Congress Parliamentary Party head Sonia Gandhi

title: T.N. Assembly adopts resolution urging Centre to withdraw Waqf (Amendment) Bill
content: “The Union government has introduced the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024, to amend the Waqf Act, 1954, and it will severely affect the Muslim minorities,” M.K. Stalin said

title: Elgar Parishad-Maoist links case: Supreme Court adjourns bail pleas of Surendra Gadling and Jyoti Jagtap
content: The Supreme Court also deferred hearing on the petition filed by the NIA challenging the bail granted to activist Mahesh Raut

title: Mumbai: Woman scientist injured in attack by two dogs; canine owner, two others booked
content: The two canines — a pitbull and a doberman — are owned Divesh Virk, and were under the care of his driver and house maid when the incident took place on March 22 morning

title: Govt approves procurement of 37.39 lakh tons of gram, lentils for 2025 rabi season
content: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said the procurement of pulses includes 27.99 lakh tonnes of gram and 9.40 lakh tonnes of lentil

title: Income Tax Department issues notices to taxpayers over non deduction of TDS on rent of ₹50,000 or more per month
content: Many taxpayers have received a notice from the Income Tax Department pertaining to the assessment years 2023-2024 and 2024-25

title: Odisha politics: Congress mobilising strength to position itself on equal footing with BJP, BJD
content: With the Biju Janata Dal seemingly losing its organisational heft, the Congress sees an opening to reaffirm it as a formidable political force in Odisha

title: Nation not built by slogans, but performing duties: Yogi Adityanath
content: Yogi Adityanath said the growing international recognition of India's traditional practices, such as yoga, under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Fresh encounter in Jammu and Kashmir’s Kathua; police personnel injured
content: The gunfight erupted on March 27, 2025, morning when the security forces spotted the terrorists near Jakhole village in Ghati Juthana area of Rajbagh

title: Toll charges to Bengaluru Airport and STRR to increase from April 1
content: The toll revision will impact all categories of road users, including private vehicle owners, taxis, ride-hailing services, airport cabs and Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) buses operating the Vayu Vajra service to the airport.

title: Grama Natham lands: Single judge of Madras HC criticises Division Bench for letting loose ‘judicial anarchy’
content: Justice Anand Venkatesh wonders how a Division Bench can choose to ignore the stand consistently taken by coordinate benches in the last 100 years

title: Yogi Adityanath terms three-language row ‘narrow politics’, Stalin says ‘BJP clearly rattled’
content: Stalin termed Yogi Adityanath’s remarks on “hate” not just irony but “political black comedy at its darkest”

title: PM Modi pens letter to Muhammad Yunus on Bangladesh National Day: ‘Mutual sensitivity to each other’s interests and concerns’
content: Prime Minister Modi, highlighting shared history and bilateral partnership, greets Prof. Yunus and Bangladesh on National Day

title: ABC 6.0: Building a sense of camaraderie through art
content: The coming week will see the Art Bengaluru Collective will hold the sixth edition of their multi-art show this weekend

title: India, China trying to rebuild ties: EAM Jaishankar
content: In October, India and China firmed up a disengagement pact for Depsang and Demchok, the last two friction points in eastern Ladakh

title: RBI imposes penalties on HDFC Bank, Punjab & Sind Bank
content: A penalty of ₹75 lakh on HDFC Bank has been imposed for non-compliance with certain directions issued by RBI on 'Know Your Customer' (KYC)

title: 11 Indian fishermen from Tamil Nadu held; one trawler seized by Sri Lankan Navy
content: According to Marine Police sources, the fishermen were engaged in fishing in the Palk Bay area and in the wee hours, the surveillance team of the Sri Lankan Navy detained the 11 fishermen and also took away the trawler

title: Kozhikode Corporation formulates comprehensive plan for city beautification
content: The Urban rejuvenation and Beautification programme includes development of Mananchira area into a walking zone and recreation zone along Conolly canal

title: Navy chief inaugurates new North Jetty at Naval Base
content: Extending 300 metres in length and 18 metres in width, the jetty is designed to berth various classes of naval ships

title: Ruling, Opposition councillors lock horns over Kochi Corporation Budget
content: While the LDF hailed the Budget as one that positively influenced all aspects of city life, the Opposition UDF termed it as one that powered development projects through debts by pawning the civic body’s assets

title: Centre aims to increase oil seed production to 70 million tonnes by 2031
content: The National Mission on Edible Oils – Oilseeds has been launched with an outlay of ₹10,103.38 crore to make India self-reliant in edible oil production, says Union Minister

title: Tunnel collapse: Strong odour at a particular location of SLBC tunnel
content: So far, two bodies have been recovered and efforts are on to recover the remaining six missing personnel.

title: Chinese scholars to visit Visva Bharati to mark 75 years of India-China diplomatic ties
content: Chinese Consul General in Kolkata Xu Wei said that Rabindranath Tagore, who visited China in 1924, is the symbol of India-China friendship

title: Ministry of Defence signs contracts worth ₹6,900 crore with Bharat Forge, Tata for 307 indigenous artillery guns
content: Being the first major procurement of towed guns from the private sector by the Indian Army, the project will provide a boost to the Indian gun manufacturing industry in particular and the indigenous defence manufacturing ecosystem as a whole, the Ministry said

title: "Black Comedy At Its Darkest": MK Stalin's Reply To Yogi Adityanath's Barbs
content: In a sharp reply to Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's criticism over the three-language row, his Tamil Nadu counterpart MK Stalin has said the firebrand leader's remarks are not irony, but "political black comedy at its darkest"

title: Trump's Latest Move A "Direct Attack", Canada Will Respond: PM Mark Carney
content: US President Donald Trump's latest move is a "direct attack" on Canada, Prime Minister Mark Carney said on Wednesday. Mr Carney was speaking about the latest tariffs imposed by President Trump, which the latter announced as a "permanent" measure.

title: "Now It's Our Turn": Putin To Visit India, Accepts PM Modi's Invite
content: Russia and India are aiming to take their bilateral ties to an all-time high, and for this, Russian President Vladimir Putin is going to visit India soon, said Russian foreign minister Sergey Lavrov.

title: To Be (With BJP) Or Not To Be, AIADMK Weighs Tamil Nadu Alliance Options
content: Assembly polls in Tamil Nadu are due next year and the key players, the ruling DMK and the main Opposition AIADMK, have started building their election planks

title: Rights Body Notice To Kerala Officials On Student's Death After NDTV Campaign
content: The top human rights body of the country has taken note of the NDTV campaign demanding justice for Chaithanya Kumari, who died on Saturday after attempting to take her life in December.

title: Amid Rana Sanga Row, Akhilesh Yadav's "Gaushala" Remark Sparks Uproar
content: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav's "gaushala vs perfume park" barb at the BJP has sparked a major row and invited a sharp retort from Uttar Pradesh's Deputy Chief Minister Keshab Prasad Maurya.

title: "Amused": Nirmala Sitharaman As AAP's Raghav Chadha Flags Bank Conditions
content: Nirmala Sitharaman, in a friendly banter, said that Raghav Chadha's exposure to the western world would help people within the country.

title: On Camera, US Woman Strips Naked, Goes On Wild Biting And Stabbing Rampage
content: A woman allegedly stripped naked, bit a person and stabbed a couple of staff members with a pencil at the Dallas Fort Worth International Airport in Texas

title: US Funding Cut Could Cause 'Over A Million Deaths': Vaccine Alliance CEO
content: The Gavi vaccine alliance's chief said on Thursday that any cut in US funding risks causing more than a million deaths, following a report that Washington is set to back out.

title: Rohit Sharma To Opt Out Of England Tests. Report Claims This Is The Reason
content: Rohit Sharma is likely to opt out of the Indian cricket team's upcoming Test series against England due to his dismal run of form in red-ball cricket, according to a report.

title: Opinion: What A Modi-Bhagwat Meet Says About RSS' Plans
content: For Modi, the next election may be the immediate goal, but for Bhagwat, elections are important yet something that can be sacrificed for the larger cause of Hindu unity.

title: Gambhir's Support Staff To See 2 Sackings For England Tests: Report
content: The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is all set to make major changes to Indian cricket team head coach Gautam Gambhir's support staff for the Test series against England, according to a report.

title: "Vladimir Putin Will Die Soon": Zelensky Claims Amid Health Rumours
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky stated in an interview that Russian President Vladimir Putin "will die soon," believing it will end the war.

title: Why Social Media Is Suddenly Flooded With Studio Ghibli-Style Art
content: From watercolour-like landscapes to hand-drawn character portraits, the internet seems to have transformed into a scene from Spirited Away or Howl's Moving Castle.

title: NDTV Explains: Trump's 25% Auto Tariffs. What Are They, Who Is Affected?
content: US President Donald Trump's 25 per cent tariff on automobiles and auto parts imported into that country - and the 25 per cent levy on steel and aluminium imports - mark a significant escalation in a global trade war brewing since he took oath in Jan.

title: Tannenbaum plays GM for every team in Round 1: Should the Giants still take a QB at No. 3?
content: draft analysts project what they believe will happen in mock drafts based on a mock draft . draft analysts say the mock draft will be a 'fake draft' for the entire first round . the draft is now less than one month away .

title: Predictions: From playoffs and World Series to MVPs and Cy Youngs
content: a comic book rendition of the biggest storylines of the upcoming Major League Baseball season gets underway tomorrow with Opening Day baseball . 28 of ESPN's MLB writers, analysts and editors on the spot to predict what will happen in baseball this year . a number of our voters have asked their voters to explain their opinions .

title: MLB Opening Day is here! What we're watching, lineups and live updates from every game
content: the opening matchup between the Colorado Rockies and Tampa Bay Rays is scheduled for friday . the new york Yankees and Milwaukee Brewers will get things started on ESPN at 3:05 p.m. ET . los Angeles Dodgers will raise their World Series banner before taking on the Detroit Tigers .

title: For Notre Dame and Marcus Freeman, writing a different ending is the final step
content: a traditional stadium walk took on a new feel for the first college football playoff game . the crowd swelled and the stadium lights popped in the distance . "it was almost like being in a movie as you're walking to the stadium," Freeman says .

title: From a famed Russian basketball academy to Provo, Egor Demin is dialed in
content: point guard Egor Demin was born into a basketball family . he tagged along to his older brother's practices when he was 2 years old . "it was really hard to think about the NBA being in Moscow, being in Russia," he says .

title: Already 2-0, Dodgers are the center of the spectacle on Opening Day
content: the Dodgers underperform this season . he faced his worst fear: nothing to do and nowhere to go . his teammate and winning pitcher was at the front of the room, sitting at a table and answering questions with expansive answers .

title: How Calipari's departure led to Kentucky, Arkansas and BYU in the Sweet 16
content: calipari's departure set off a domino effect that rivals anything college basketball has seen over the past decade . the team's second first-round exit from the NCAA tournament in three years . "he's been married 40-plus years, so we're sort of, like, semi-married," coach says .

title: Inside Brandon Graham's final, turbulent, triumphant season as an Eagle
content: he began writing bullet points on a piece of paper and slowly added to it as the weeks went on . he was the longest tenured Eagle of all time and author of the most impactful play in team history . his wife, carlyne, said he had a lot of ground to cover .

title: "Have Zero Tolerance": US Cancels 2,000 Visa Appointments By "Bots" In India
content: embassy detected major violations in the appointment system by "bad actors" or bots . the embassy is cancelling about 2000 visa appointments made by bots, it says . "we have zero tolerance for agents and fixers that violate our scheduling policies," they add . in 2022, waiting times ranged from 800 to 1,000 days .

title: Salman Khan NDTV Exclusive: "If I Have To Work With Ananya Or Janhvi..."
content: NDTV asked Salman Khan about working with younger actresses and box office pressures . he says the makers don't come to us and say, "Oh, it's a loss!" when the film is a flop, the makers come to the theatres and say: "I think the onus is on the star to bring the audience in"
